Summary Heading: Comfortable bed, hot water and not much else
Summary: The bed was comfortable, the shower hot and the air conditioner reliable. The room was only cleaned once during our 10 night stay, even though we requested cleaning twice. There was only one small garbage can. I discovered a burn hole in a sheet. There was a table but it was very sticky. We saw what we believed to be cockroaches a couple of times. Had we not locked in our stay with Hotwire (buyer beware) and been on a tight budget, we would have left after one night
Room tip: Avoid this place if you‚Äôre staying more than one night.

Summary: The rooms were big for the price. Nice üëçnot to many bad people walking around very quiet. I also liked it was by many fast food places! Will come back and recommend for anyone looking for a good day!

Summary Heading: Gave our room away after plenty of warning
Summary: We let this hotel know plenty of times that we were going to be arriving late. At least 3 different times we were told it was okay. We got there... not only was the area gross and creepy. We also got rejected from the room because they said we were late... We were trapped at 4 am with nowhere to go. I would never recommend this place. I'm sorry.

Summary Heading: Stay only if you‚Äôre on a tight budget
Summary: Room was very filthy, as if it had never been cleaned aside from the bedsheets & some towels. Our room could use a day‚Äôs worth of decommissioning for a thorough clean. Filth all over the walls and books & crannies such as light switches. Fire alarm had been removed and a plastic bag stuffed into its spot. Poor place to stay and would not recommend unless you absolutely have to. Hot water and comfortable bed.

My stay here was initially for one night (for the convenience of being closer to work) and it was honestly a last minute decision... (literally 11:59 PM).  The man at the front desk still greeted me with the most welcoming smile. There are about 9 (or more) rooms right next to one another and on the same side of the street and I have visited 2 before coming to Anaheim Lodge. The rooms here are much nicer on the inside than they appear on the outside. I regret not coming to this place before the others now... I would have saved a few dollars while enjoying a clean spacious room that is bug free. Needless to say, that one night....turned into two nights. Haven't left yet, but so far so good. I'd love to stay another night like last night, but tomorrow happens to be my day off.
Room tip: You'll always get one of the nicer rooms of the of the bunch when booking online prior to...

Summary: We originally booked this hotel for 3 nights, but checked out after 1 night.  Although the owners are pleasant, the hotel has no basic amenities and was rundown and very dirty (see photo of filthy desk chair).  There was no dresser in the room, nor anywhere to hang clothes.  No kleenex, no hair dryer, no coffee, no breakfast and very poor internet service.  I can't believe there were so many positive reviews for this place, it is really a dump.

I really enjoyed staying at Anaheim Lodge. The room was very big and clean. There was a microwave. Staff was really friendly. Parking is free. Wi-fi works really good. Great place when you are visiting Disneyland.

I feel generous giving this place an average rating, I‚Äôm actually teetering more towards giving it a poor rating. The reviewers that gave it an excellent rating must have extremely low standards or they‚Äôre  completely bogus.  PROS: 1) It was much more quiet then I expected it to be. 2) Didn‚Äôt see any bugs.   CONS: 1) It‚Äôs a shady area, so there‚Äôs a concern for safety and parking. 2) I don‚Äôt think you can call the pool a pool, it‚Äôs more like a sinkhole - it‚Äôs dirty, doesn‚Äôt appear to be maintained, and I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôd catch a disease if you went swimming. 3) Stray cats roam the property and trash is strewn about. 4) A serious lack of attention to detail - there was slime looking caulking goop dripped onto the baseboards, a hole in the bathroom wall behind the toilet, a thick layer

Summary Heading: You only get what you pay for!
Summary: The positive- Man on front desk was just lovely. The beds and pillows were comfortable (although no mattress or pillow protectors on anything). Now for a truly honest review. The rooms were surface clean only. Very dusty bed heads, lights, lamp bases. A throw over the bed that was all stained. Still clean I'm sure but why use it? Only a sheet on the bed. Had to ask for blankets and extra pillows as there was only 1 each. A microwave but no cuttlery/crockery. No hairdryer or safe as advertised on booking.com. Nowhere to hang clothes. 3 draws to store clothes and that's it. Furniture with handles missing and most of it has seen better days. No facilities to even make a drink. People hanging around the accomodation at night which made us feel vulnerable. Clearly this isn't just a

Me and my family stayed here from nov 12- 14 the staff was very friendly. The location is great. Close to a lot of things. Room was very clean and modern we will definitely return in the future !!!!!!

I stayed here towards the end of my family trip.  We stayed here from 11th October-19th October.  The room was pleasant, clean, and well looked after.  The manager/staff was always accomodating to us. I would highly recommend staying here for visitors or families to stay here.   I would stay here again, it is close to everything, laundromat, Bank Of America, food places and easy to get too.

The front desk staff was very friendly, the rates are low, the room we had was fairly clean and the bed was comfortable, that is where the good ends. We arrived about an hour after check in, got our room key went to go get settled in and our room is not ready, housekeepers tell us it will be at least 20 more minutes we opt to wait after talking to the front desk. We finally get into our room, there is no blanket on the bed, no coffee machine, no blow dryer, no iron nothing. This is literally your bare bones hotel room. The parking lot is dirty, trash everywhere and a random colony of stray cats, clearly some guests live in this hotel and feed these cats. We even saw cats inside some of the hotel rooms! Oh and then there was the pool, gross, dirty, things floating and then the

My boyfriend and I stayed there on the weekend. We didn't have any issues and the bed was super comfortable. Will be coming back if ever need to visit Anaheim again. The price was a good deal and our room came with a mini fridge and a microwave.

If your on a tight budget this motel could work for you. We stayed 3 nights at 65 US per night. The room was adequate. It was very basic. We had a King bed room on the 2nd floor. Fairly nice room, furniture was worn but worked. We did notice some smudges of food ? , on the desk chair that housecleaning should have wiped off. The bed was comfortable, sheets were worn, a small tear on one side. The bathroom area was new, very clean, nice shower lots of hot water. We slept very well, having said that we always wear earplugs when traveling and had the fan on auto but we did not hear any talking or waterpipe noises. We would recommend this motel to anyone looking for bare bones, low priced accommodations. One final note: we are from Canada, not sure if it's the same for everyone (and

Summary Heading: The worse Hotel we have ever almost stayed in
Summary: My family booked this hotel based on the reviews on line.  The hotel requires payment up front and does so before you ever see the room , we paid for three nights.  When we entered the room it was highly perfumed to cover what smelled like smoking.  There was no sheet on the bed and with further investigation we found a mattress cover stains and  evidence of blood stains and bugs.  We grabs our belongs and children immediately and removed them from the room.  We went to the office we‚Äôre the person who took our money told us we would have to wait for the owner for a refund.  We waited for the owner and asked him to go to the room to verify what we found, he refused to and refused to refund our money,  After much discussion he agreed to refund half of what we paid.  We also saw a

Summary Heading: What there is, is average. But it lacks features found in other hotels of comparable price
Summary: It's clean & comfortable & quiet (perhaps explaining some of the high ratings) but this hotel lacks features you would expect to find in a hotel in this price bracket, namely: 1) No hairdryer is provided 2) No ice is available (On a 6 month roadtrip across the US, this is the ONLY budget hotel we have seen with no ice machine or ice chest) 3) No breakfast is provided, at all, not even coffee 4) Service is sub-standard, with the hotel office not open in the morning (maybe late morning but not early morning when you need to talk to them before you go out for the day). In addition, our room was rough around the edges: 1) An unpainted wall in the bathroom where probably a plumbing repair had been done 2) A constantly leaking cistern that had been leaking for so long into the toilet

Pros: PRICE. What a great deal, for this location.  Our room, beds and bathroom were clean.  I stayed for a week and I saw and spoke with the owner several times as we were coming and going.  He seemed really nice and was very responsive to our needs.  Cons: Pool was small but sufficient.  Towels were tired and a few really should be gotten rid of but they did the job.  Indifferent: pillows were really heavy.  They weren't uncomfortable but they were really heavy and solid so if you want a light and soft pillow, bring it.  Or just go to Walmart and buy a cheap one.  If you had a pillow fight, you could knock someone unconscious.  If you had the strength to swing it.  Not exaggerating.    Overall: If i came to the area again, I'd definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: only thing clean was the actual bed...at least it looked clean for one day.
Summary: I will never stay here again, or anywhere near S Beach Blvd.  I try to find the best deals, but this room was filthy and disgusting. The actual bed was ok, but layers of dirt/food/grime all over walls/baseboards/doors/windows.  The owners seemed nice, but need to thorougly clean this property. My room was only cleaned once during a 5 night trip. I had to ask for clean towels, and all the clean towels were stained.   The neighborhood is very sketchy, many transient people, many appeared to be on drugs. I did not feel safe in the parking lot. Its surrounded by other motels that rent by the week, for a very cheap price.  I will never stay here or around this area again.  On the good side, we were not bit by bed bugs...I was waiting for that to happen, and wouldn't be surprised if

I forgot to take pictures but the cleanliness left MUCH to be desired. Then again, for the price I wasn‚Äôt expecting much.  The walls and baseboards were filthy. The tops of the framed artwork above the beds were disgustingly dusty. Just being there made me feel dirty. We just needed a cheap place to sleep since we went to Disneyland and California Adventure for 2 days. It served its purpose. At least there weren‚Äôt any bed bugs, as far as I could tell (I inspected the mattresses and furniture drawers.). No bed bugs just stray hairs and a spider on one of the beds.

Summary Heading: Would still return...but not as clean as usual.
Summary: We've stayed here several times (probably 1/2 a dozen)...and this was the first time we really had any issue with cleanliness. BOTH of the queen beds had hair/boogers/other nastiness on the sheets. One bedspread had cigarette burns, there was something really nasty looking smeared on the wall. I called the front desk and the managers wife came and changed our sheets. It's family managed, they live downstairs and they try VERY hard to make everyone happy. I didn't feel it was their fault, but the housekeeping needed a refresher for sure. Everything else was fine. **BRING A HAIR DRYER if you need one...they don't have them!** We'd stay here again for the price. It's about 1 20 minute drive to Disneyland in the morning with traffic. Easy drive too.

For the value of staying near Disneyland Anaheim Lodge accommodates the needs. If you are expecting a 3+ star hotel for less than a $100 per night go elsewhere. Location and staff is the key at this property.

While when we checked in the guy was lovely. Alof of feral people hanging around very scary at some stage. I accidently left a pair of expensive nikes behind and i did not recieve a phone call or an email back !!!!!!! I would have given them a higher rating if they just replied to my email!

Summary Heading: Our room was nothing like in the photos
Summary: We stayed in room 201. It was pretty beat up compared to the ones in the photos posted by the management and guest(s). I'll explain below:  We only had one table to put our belongings on. There was no dress to put our clothes in. We just had to pile them on top of the huge table in the hotel room.    We didn't have any hangers to hang out clothes up.   The sheets and blanket(s) provided were very worn out and had stains on them.   Their were scuffs all over the wall(s) with what looked like dry food, blood, snot, or whatever was on it around TV area.   Cables were dangling below/behind TV.   Over half of the plug ins didn't work to plug in our electronic devices.   TONS of hair in the bath tub I had to clean out and in shower curtain.  LOTS of people shouting and screaming

Our room was simple and affordable. It was clean and roomy. It did not have a lot of frills, but since we went just for Disney by the time we got back all we needed was a nice place to sleep. I would recommend!

I was able to get affordable accommodations at the last minute. I was impressed with the room and the renovations of the hotels accommodations. The grounds were very clean and the rooms were immaculate. The personnal at the property were very friendly and more than accomidating. They took a genuine interest in their guests. I was not rushed at checkout and my time was extended without any problems. I will definitely be going back to stay on other occasions.

Clean room and staff is polite. Guy at the front desk is amazing and helpful. There‚Äôs no other hotel I‚Äôd stay at..I wasn‚Äôt paid to leave this review and I‚Äôm not a bot either. I genuinely enjoyed my stay and I‚Äôll be back soon! This hotel is the only place I‚Äôll stay at!

We usually go to Disneyland once a year and always stay at this hotel.  The owner, Danny, is such a nice man and always makes us feel so welcome.  The area is safe and quiet, the rooms are clean, prices are great and just a short drive to Disneyland!

we stayed here for 4 nights for Disneyland. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you're wanting to go to Disneyland everyday like we did but we booked late and were on a budget so this was our best bet.  It was a lovely lodge, very clean room and great bed and the staff were very friendly. Walking distance to food and general stores. It was a $10 Uber ride to and from Disneyland. We had a great experience.

Really good rooms.  Stayed there twice both times great. Good night sleeps Easy to find and lovely staff. Really worth the money. Also not to far a drive from all the main attractions WiFi was good sometimes but did slow down on occasion.

Summary Heading: Basic clean motel serves the purpose
Summary: Clean large rooms with refrigerator microwave.Serves the purpose perfectly. Only problem is heater/ac is very noisy. Close to disneyland 6-7 dollars Uber rode away.No breakfast available.TV remote signal receiver at the back of the tv ,thats not practical.

Summary Heading: Great deal for the price, clean and quiet.
Summary: Stayed there after disney parks and it was literally 10 minutes away, very kind person at the front desk. Clean, quiet and cheap what else can you ask for?  Will definitelly stay there again because I got the 3 day park ticket.

We stayed here for 4 nights in order to be close to Disney.   If you don't have a car it took roughly half an hour to walk to the closest walmart. But in the other direction there is lots of fast food places which is super convenient.   The guy at the front desk was super friendly. We got to chose whether we wanted to be ground floor or on the second floor. We chose ground floor because our bags were so heavy.   The room was super clean. With 2 double beds, a microwave and a fridge. Everything was lush, and the air conditioning was a dream come true. It should not be this hot in October. It's unnatural for the British.   The pool left a little to be desired but I wouldn't discount it for that. It looked like one of the better motels of the area. With constant Wi-Fi and a t.v.

Summary Heading: This Place was Great for the price!!
Summary: Stayed here Aug 23-26 and loved it. Stayed in room 202 just above the office and it was recently remodeled. Nice hardwood floors and new furniture. It was in a great location,,,about 5 mins North to Knottsberry Farm, and about a 15 minute straight shot to Huntington Beach( a must see). Sea Lions were hanging out by the pier and the waves were incredible! This location was totally safe and there were plenty of amenities within walking distance, an authentic Mexican supermarket is about 2 minutes away It was clean and safe and I would definitely stay here again!!

Honestly this hotel was really nice. If you are on a budget this spot is the place to go, apart from it being close to Disneyland  the location was not bad at all. The rooms were also nice and clean I cannot complain. I suggest anyone looking to save some money this is a good spot to go to.

Beds were a bit hard..bugs in the bathroom, AC worked great, small space, bedroom was very clean. Only one lock on the front door..didn't feel completely safe. Pool is teeny tiny and  dirty. Office staff was nice and easy to work with.

Please do not go here!!! I am a disabled veteran with brain injury and can no longer drive. The owner asked where my car was and even after explaining (although I did not owe an explanation) that I can no longer drive, I was refused a room for the night. Anaheim Lodge, you should be ashamed of yourself!!!

Summary Heading: comfortable and clean lodge with extremely helpful owner!
Summary: Profoundly surprised and fortunate to find this place where we needed to crash in before heading to SF. Rooms very new and clean. Owner was extremely helpful in going beyond to meet our special needs specially with needs of our little kid in the middle of the night. Would highly recommend for folks coming in to visit theme parks around anaheim or even otherwise...this is great place to stay!

The gentleman at the front desk was very kind and the room was inexpensive and very nice and clean. 5 stars would recommend. Also was able to find and book last minute and checkout is at 11am. Great place to take the family after Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Very nice rooms, much better than expected
Summary: Our room was very nice with a comfy King bed, excellent A/C, very clean.  The door had been broken on the fridge, but the fridge worked OK.  No coffee and no ice.  Overall, a good value.  I would stay here again.

Overall, the hotel was ok for the price and my short stay ( a few hours layover) Free parking, free internet. The room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was ok and clean. The lobby was very very small and the air felt stale. That said, did't need to be there for long.

the outside made it look a bit sketch to stay at but the room was nice and big with hardwood floors and a bathtub. it was really clean when we got there. it was worth it and the people there were sweet

nice place to stay staff was friendly and helpful beds were comfortable i enjoy my stay there nice price $130 for 2 nights and the room was nice and clean there was only 1 thing wrong the tv remote did not work but they fixed it

I wanted to do Disney for our Anniversary but finances made it a little tricky. This little motel was very inexpensive, but very clean. We arrived around 9 PM and after 10 hours in the car I just wanted a hot shower and to fall into bed. Unfortunately, there was no hot water. NONE. It was barely tepid. I called the front desk and the manager came 15 minutes later and was able to get it slightly warmer but it still wasn't hot. I took a cold shower and went to sleep. The room overall is just bare bones but includes a fridge and microwave. No blow dryer so bring your own. I love that there is no carpet.  We only had 1 other night with no hot water. But still 2 out of 4 nights, I felt we should have been comped something- especially since we didn't even stay that 4th night (we left

The rooms had been obviously updated but they were not clean. Cobwebs in the corner.  The bathroom ceiling fan was caked with dust. Grease (i think) all over the bathroom door moldings. It looks like someone had a party in the room and threw mixed drinks against the wall. There were streaks on the wall that were gross. Hair in the bed.  For the price I would have expected better. If it was just me I wouldnt care but I would not take my wife and children.  Not a kid friendly pool or atmosphere.

Very close to disney and close to a lot of food places. Theres plenty of space to park. Fast service and the hotel room was very nice and cheap. So i do recommend this hotel for anyone that comes to the theme parks.

On a one night lay-over in LA I was looking for an easy, affordable, clean, room.  This no frills motel filled my needs. Although the room was worn and dated, the bed was good and the bathroom clean. Even though the hotel was only about 20 miles from LAX, it took me over 1-hr in my rental car during mid-day traffic. There's no quick way to get there from LAX. The $68 / night room rate was the attraction.

I highly recommend this stay.   Fast check in, pleasant stay, and even faster check out.  Friendly and enjoyable hotel clerk.  The hard wood floors were a nice touch and the fridge and microwave, a great bonus.

The price was the very least we could get on a three day weekend at under $150 for anything within 10 miles of Disney. I was worried but optimistic because of the reviews. I was not let down. I am not ever looking for frills at this price but I do expect clean and safe. This is all I got.   This place is not in the prime area of Anaheim nor do I recommend walking with the family for an evening stroll. Parking was a bit tight the first night but it was lit well and there were a couple of spots opened. I only saw three people standing around but they didn't follow or stare creepily so I checked in. The office has a smell that'll make you consider changing your mind but it goes fast. The gal at check in was very pleasant and the fellow that came in to assist was the same. No qualms

Great little motel. If you're looking to visit Disneyland or any of the surrounding areas of attraction I highly recommend. The manager is very kind and stayed up late to allow myself and my girlfriend to check in around 1 am. Incredibly professional room is very clean and service is great. Will definitely be back again next time we make a trip to so cal.

Not a bad choice for a strict budget. Definitely not homey though. There was a gap under our door, the sink drained slowly, and one of the rags wasn't totally clean. But the bathroom was spotless, and the beds were comfortable. The price is the cheapest there is. We had to leave early and management was extremely kind about giving us a full refund. Management was five star. I'd recommend to anybody who's not picky about perfect cleanliness. It's a good choice.

The staff was nice and helpful we had an awesome stay. It was easy to find and a great location down the street from Disneyland and not far from Knott's Berry farm. There were also many places to choose to eat. I would really recommend this place to anyone that is headed to Anaheim to stay at the Anaheim Lodge.

Summary Heading: Not too bad for the location and price.
Summary: Not bad experience.  Satisfactory rating. For the price, can't complain much. Would be better if there can be some hangers and hanging rack just to hang the clothes up.  Staff were fine but over-reacting coz fearing i would leave a bad review. Haha.... But they can kinda deodorise their reception or 'lobby' as it smell too 'curry'.

This was a very pleasant find. Considering what was paid per night I must say that our expectations were far exceeded. It appears as though the rooms were recently renovated or meticulously maintained. I was impressed with the modern bathroom and fact that the tub had no caulk line were it met the tile (major issue even at 4+ star hotels and resorts). The beds were comfortable as were the pillows. I am a traveling sales manager for a national Fortune 200 company and I spend 80%+ of the year in hotel rooms. Every now and then I gamble on a non-branded chain and it paid off this time. When I am in the Los Angeles/Anaheim area I will definitely book at this establishment again.

Summary Heading: Good if you dont want to spend much
Summary: It was ok, nice place to stay for a couple of days if you dont want to spend much. Room smelled a bit like smoke and it was probably because of people outside smoking. If people on the next room are too loud you can definitely hear them.

If you want to save money then go for it. We checked in and 2 hours later checked out. Bathroom smelled. The other guests out there looked like they were going to rob us. I tried to save money but it's a lesson learned. In the room it was just dirty. The fridge had nasty towels in it. The sheets had blood stains. Horrible!

My boyfriend and I stayed here 3 nights during our california roadtrip. It doesn't look very nice from the outside, but we were pleasantly surprised about the inside of the room. Didn't look bad at all and most important it was clean. Good parkinglot and no strange people hanging around.  Location is very convenient when visiting disney land or knott's berry farm.  Only downside about our stay was the fact that the cleaninglady had left our window open with all our belongings in the room.

Summary Heading: Much nicer inside than it appears from outside
Summary: Our room was one of the nicer rooms I've stayed in lately; it was VERY clean. The manager kindly gave us a room that had just been redone (second floor in the northern building).  The floor in the bed area is that kind of laminate that looks like wood, but as I just said, it was new and very clean (and probably a lot easier to keep that way than carpet, so I don't fault them for that decision). Some of the furniture is apparently pre-remodel, but was still clean and perfectly acceptable for storing clothes in (if you're the sort of person who bothers to unpack at a motel instead of just grabbing clothes out of your suitcase). Room had a mini-fridge which was perfectly adequate for storing two 2-liter bottles of soda with some room left over. Bathroom had a tile floor with what

I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and each time is better than the last.  The customer service is better than most five star hotels. It is freshly refurbished.  It is run by one brother but the other is on hand constantly helping.  They offered to carry my bags in and couldn't do enough to help.  If you can talk cricket, all the better.  (I can't)  Unfortunately it was booked out for the days I wanted this trip, so next time I will be sure to book earlier.

Me and my bf and kids always come to this hotel every month its one of the best hotels the people that own it our super friendly its right next to any place you need super convient and affordable we love it üíú

This looks like an older motel that has been renovated.  Our room was very clean .  The shower was nice and clean . I would definitely stay here for the price and save the difference for all the fun things you can do in Anaheim!

I stayed on the second floor and the room had no dresser. Comforters had holes and half the outlets did not work in the room.The office smelled of old food i literally gagged. room is half updated. Fridge was leaking and you really get the vibe the management is watching you even tho the man was friendly he was watching the camera's like it was the nightly news.

I booked this hotel through expedia. We got there after a long drive and were going to check in and go for dinner with family out there. My brother and nephew came with us to help quickly unload and take off. When we got there the lady working there wouldn't let us check in she said we would have to pay extra for our guest. I let her know they weren't staying and just helping unload our bags. I'm assuming she was thinking we were trying to sneak them in our room. I parked right at the front door in clear view of the staff if I was trying to sneak someone in I would of parked out of sight. The lady working the front desk called another lady over and they talked in a different language for a few minutes. They then called the manager and handed me the phone I had no clue why. But

Hotel was a great value and very clean office staff was very helpful only bummer for us room did not come with coffee maker hotel with centrally located between Knott's Berry.  Farm and hotel with centrally located between Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland we would recommend this hotel and definitely stay at this hotel again if we are back in the area

I cant really say much as we only used it for sleeping. What I very much like is the parking area. It was kind of a secluded area and was very hard to have cars vandalized. I appreciated that very much. Also the fact that they reserved my rooms even though I got there extremely late for check in. Very friendly people.

Very clean and modern room! Danny and his team were very friendly and helpful. Our early check in was no trouble either. There are plenty of nice places to eat nearby and theme parks are a short distance away making the location very convenient. Would definitely recommend.

Check in was fast and easy and the front desk DANNY knew who I was soon as I walk in cause I had call him earlier  Rooms are exactly how it shows in the photos rooms was clean and equipped with everything you need hardwood floors was a PLUS. The only thing  I  never remember having to lock a hotel window before I always just had to close the curtains so we actually sleep with the windows open with just screen closed so just make sure u check your windows  maybe every one already does i don't blame anyone for that but my self...overall good and confi place

Clean well serviced room in a convenient location. Lovely staff, nothing was too much trouble. After being let down by the motel we had previously booked Danny and his team really looked after us.  Would definitely stay here again.

The room was clean, nobugs, parking was close, staff was friendly and it is 10 minutes from DisneyLand. We asked for an iron and one was provided. Pool is very small but we didn't use it anyway.   I would most definitely stay here again.

Our room was very clean and the wood laminate flooring looked new. There was a microwave and fridge in the room but no cups or ice bucket. We had a bit of a challenge finding the right water temperature and keeping the tub filled when we were bathing the kids but other than that the service was great. The gentleman at the front desk was very polite. I actually booked our room for the wrong date but he was really patient and got us into another room without trouble (it was the last room with double beds too, what luck). I was going to take the kids to the pool but after seeing it, I wasn't even sure if it was open. There are several food and restaurant options nearby and two great parks not more than 5 minutes away. Definitely a good hotel for the family if you're on a budget and

Needed a last minute room to stay the night after leaving Knotts berry farm...very close to the park. Availability and their customer service was great. Room was in excellent condition, clean, and very comfortable. Will definitely consider staying here again if needed.

We stayed here for one night as it is a short drive to Disneyland. We were impressed with how nice the rooms were with new bathrooms and hardwood floors. The room was extremely clean and recently remodeled. We would definitely stay here again if we are looking for something in the area.

Summary Heading: It is great for it's purpose.....to sleep.
Summary: I just spent the last six days and five nights at FIVE DIFFERENT hotels.  I had some hesitations when I booked this hotel. I arrived in Anaheim on Wednesday, June 29, 2016 and chose this place because it was a short driving distance to Disneyland. So it was only for me to rest and leave in the morning. I had booked two rooms. One for myself and one for friends joining me for Disneyland.   Checking in was quick and painless. It is ran by a couple. When I requested something, the woman at the front desk replied "my husband will bring it right over." We were in rooms 117 and 218. For a rate of $65 for each room, you definitely get the bang for your buck. Both rooms were exactly the same. My room had a king size bed, a refrigerator, and a microwave. Rooms had hardwood floors, with

We stayed for 5 days 4 nights for a family trip and it was an awesome hotel! Danny the manager is super nice and helpful with anything you ask him for... Will for sure be staying again down the road.. Not a long drive to any of the park or the beach so it's a win win in our book..

Our family of four stayed here for one night while we were visiting Disneyland.  It was clean and we felt safe.  We definitely did not see any shady characters that were mentioned in another review.  Friendly and excellent customer service. We would stay here again.  Free wifi too!

We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. This place is not in the best location! Shady looking people hanging out in the parking lot at night. The room has been renovated, but it's very very small. The bathroom toilet and shower is in the same area and u barely have enough room to dress after showering. The tv sat on top of a table but right above it was a tv mount with lots of cables and wires. The beds are super cheap, hard and extremely uncomfortable!!! The room doesn't have an iron, blow dryer, or telephone!! I had to ask to get a iron and hair dryer üòï. We will never stay here again!!

This hotel is clean and safe. Hardwood floors are much cleaner feeling than carpet. Disneyland is 15 minutes away, Knotsberry is down the street. Danny the hotel manager is unduplicable! Danny is the whip cream & cherry at Anaheim Lodge. No breakfast. Don't hesitate to book here. We stayed several nights & will stay here again when in the area. Thanks Danny!!! Ask Danny for the good local restaurants - he knows them!!! :-)

Perfect for an overnight stay. Small, quiet, and visibly tidy. Would like to thank Danny the hotel manager who helped us sort through a third party error when our reservation was booked for the wrong night. He was very patient with the situation, and was able to book us a room for the same night. Appreciative and happy with the customer service.

Really clean rooms and great service! Everything in their rooms worked to perfection. It was really hot when we visited so we crancked up the AC and was as if we were back in the winter time. It's a great location, just down the street is Knotts Berry Farm, Midevil Times and some really good restaurants.

Danny the owner has gone above and beyond for me! It is very comfortable to be here. It is not one of those places owners are extremely nosy and treat you like an inconvenience when you need something but this place will do anything possible to make your stay one you'll really appreciate.   TJ

They have laminate floors which is always so nice for cleanliness!  It did make it hard to have the kids in and out of the pool always cleaning up puddles or else very slippy,  but a carpet by the door would fix that pretty easy!  The rooms were VERY nice and VERY clean! I was impressed because their prices are "budget" prices but it was not a budget experience. Pool is nice, and clean, our kids were the only ones crazy enough to go in it in that weather, that's Canadian's for you!  Staff is nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Quick Trip and Daniel the Fantastic Owner
Summary: Arrived at noon which is early for a check in simply to get a key so we could come back at 3. Not only did he check us in right then and there but Daniel (the owner i believe) let us get into the room and leave our luggage 3 hours early! My Fianc√© and i attended  multiple attractions during our stay but always looked forward to coming back to the room. It was wood flooring and tile in the bathroom. A very nice shower and it came with DirecTV for that late night lounging. All in all i would recommend this spot highly for how little we paid!

Summary Heading: Decent Low Budget Motel, Recently Renovated, Low Ammenities
Summary: Overall this hotel is pretty decent for being low budget.  Pros: - The room seemed like it was recently renovated, could use a few paint touch ups, but overall pretty good. - Free Parking/Internet - Decent Security - Comfortable bed - Rooms was clean, no mold/bugs etc.. - Close to Shopping/Knotts Berry Farm (5min)  Cons: - Minimal amenities (no alarm clock, no coffee maker) - Questionable neighborhood - Outdoor pool was small, little bit murky, looked like nobody used it.

This is a great, simple, inexpensive motel close to Disneyland.  We slept here with no problems whatsoever for six nights.  The staff is friendly and always helpful.  The room was very clean.  If you are need a place to crash after 16 hour long Disney marathons with the family, this place fits the bill.  I do plan on staying here again.

My family went to Disney and came back to the hotel and it was clean smelt great and amazing customer service. They were really sweet and on it. Great place. The people at the front desk do take the next step to try to do their best. Even taking note on were we staying to ask how my trip was.

Summary Heading: Nice get away for my husband and I
Summary: Have stayed several times always had a nice quite room The staff is very frienfly. For this area it has been one of the best as far as keeping the rif raft out of the parking lots I read a couple of reviews saying people are digging in the trash cans. I m a former Hotel general manger. You can't watch everything every minute . I've observed goings on and the manger is right on top  of things. Do remember this is a motel not a fancy Hotel.For the price it's great.Only thing it needs is small microwaves in the rooms.Older people and people that have children really need these.Breakfast would be nice but not necessary But you should a least offer coffee or hot tea,that would make it even greater.

It's good just to sleep in.. Room's are OK. The owner is very nice. I must say I was a Lil dissatisfied because room were not to clean and sheets were yellow... I was okay to stay since we just slept and we were out most of the time.  I hope this helps.

Summary Heading: Good little motel - good value for money
Summary: The room is nice and modern, not very big but nice big TV and fridge.  The motel staff is friendly. The wifi works great. The location is great, near restaurants and fastfood. I would recommend this motel to others.

One night stopover - Perfect. Friendly staff, clean, basic, comfortable budget rooms. Terrific for the price. Late check out.  No breakfast or tea/coffee facilities. Close to Disneyland.  Not good for long stay.

Summary Heading: Good for Disney but not much else.
Summary: Friendly staff and a good location for Disney (about 10 minutes) but there is very little else in the area. The rooms are new and have a great TV-big with lots of channels! But they were quite dirty-dusty and dirty floors. The free wifi was good but there were some rather unsavoury people in the car park and the pool didn't really look safe. Pretty standard motel that did its job, but we wouldn't return.

Summary Heading: Staff steals your things, don't stay here!!
Summary: This was by far the WORST experience we've ever had staying at a hotel!!  My wife and I stayed here while going to Disneyland for our anniversary. We were going to stay for three days, but we left the last night.  We had returned back from the park to find that our luggage had been opened and rummaged through, our clothes in the dressers disorganized after they looked for stuff, some of my wife's expensive articles missing, and our toiletries thrown away after they were disassembled and thrown in the trash can. The staff didn't even bother to throw our trash out! They just put our articles on top of the trash we had previously disposed of, and called it good.  We called the front desk, who told us the manager would be by within about 20 minutes. 45 minutes later he shows up. His

The welcome was nice at front desk, manager (Danny) even took us to show us the room before we signed any papers. We knew the hotel was going renovation before we stayed from previous reviews,  room was adequately stocked but few items were missing, manager immediately provided us with them himself, he even brought us a brand new microwave that was not placed in room yet (renovation) Room had new A/C with climate control We felt safe in this property, location is great (proximity to Disneyland and Knots Berry Farm) restaurants and shops/grocery all around it Value for the stay was great (during high season) Manager noted that they have few more months to finish renovation and are going to have a breakfast room

Summary Heading: The owner is a very nice person.
Summary: On Friday the 8th of August I stayed at this hotel and had a nice experience. When I arrived at the hotel with my wife, we though that the hotel was in a bad shape because the exterior was under construction, but it was not the case: the interior had been remodeled and was very clean. The doors have the new electronic locking system and we felt very safe. The air conditioning was brand new and worked perfectly. The bathroom was brand new. Even the floor was brand new. In short, everything was new and operational. The next day when my wife and I arrived home, I noticed that I had left my driver's license at the hotel and I called Danny (the owner). He said that he would mail it back to me, which he did. Today I got my driver's licence in the mail and I was so happy. I would

Summary Heading: i wish i left it for another hotel
Summary: First of all, the sheets were filthy.  At first sight there's people digging in the trash dumpster and hanging outside in the parking lot.  Second, it will freak you out when they try to speak to you or get your attention and retreat back to their rooms and you realize that you are going to sleep next door to them.  I didn't even feel safe parking my car and it was hard to sleep.  I heard noise and stood up to check out the window and saw the same people either smoking or hanging out in the parking lot.  And that woman that was mentioned in another review lives on the property and is in charge of cleaning the rooms but at night she does linger outside.  I feel like half of the rooms are filled with people who live there.  Next time when placed in a similar situation I will

We chose this motel because it was near Disneyland . Pulling up to the parking lot I already felt a bad vibe.  There was a homeless guy digging in the trash and peeping in the back of someone's truck bed.  What I did like was that the room was recently renovated. I could tell that the floors and bathroom had been done.  BUT, I checked the bed, and man they were disgusting. There were gross looking stains on the sheets, a lot of them. It looked like they didn't wash the sheets very well. Made me not want to sleep in the bed at all. And the bathroom towels, looked like it haven't even been washed, lucky thing we had towels in the car for us to use. And if you're wondering about a pool, DON'T use it! It looks disgusting.  Looked like someone urinated in the pool and it seems like

My wife and I recently took a driving tour of California over a two week period. While in LA we went to an Angels game and after wanted to find a place nearby to rest for the night. Based on the reviews I read ( which I believe are wrote by people on crack) I booked a room here for the night.  Upon arrival I knew I had made a mistake. The lodge is in really bad shape on the outside and you could see the people that were outside there were not of the highest quality.   Since the room had been prepaid online I decide to go in and at least see what it was like. We were walked to our room by the owner and the room had be updated BUT the sheets had not been washed, and there was a red substance which I hope was food all over the sheets. The room directly over us had a lady that keep

The place is all brand new. From the outside, you couldn't tell how good it really is. The price was super cheap for the area on the weekend. Everything was brand new. The floor, the beds, the TV, etc. Free WIFI and HBO. The renovation wasn't completly done when I went, but mostly there, and all the important stuff was done.

Okay, this is going to be long but this place deserves it!!   I stayed at this motel while visiting the area (I'm from SoCal but wanted to avoid traffic) and I have to say that this is the best motel (& it's still really affordable) in all of SoCal. First, I was checked in by the Manager, Danny, who gives you that 'hotel hospitality'. He personally walked me to my room and double-checked that everything I needed was there and that I was satisfied (what motel does that?). I got to speak with him a bit while walking and apparently they just bought the place from the previous management and are going through a  complete renovation, which was evident because the rooms are georgeous!! There are very nice wood floors, attractive furniture and decor, nice size television, pretty bed
